snippet: From January to August, El Salvador recorded 4,246 homicides, an average of 17.5 a day.
abstract: El Salvador's National Forensics Institute says country has averaged 17.5 murders per day since January and reported 911 murders in August, highest monthly total since country's civil war ended in 1992; police blame surge on increased gang violence since truce with groups fell apart last year.
lead_paragraph: From January to August, El Salvador recorded 4,246 homicides, an average of 17.5 a day.

headline.main: El Salvador: Gangs Drive Surge in Murders, Police Say
headline.print_headline: The Americas; El Salvador: Gangs Drive Surge in Murders, Police Say
